articles.title: Higher commodity costs lead to price hikes from Kimberly-Clark
articles.description: Kimberly-Clark said Wednesday that it would hike prices on staples like Scott toilet paper and Huggies diapers.
articles.content:
Kimberly-Clark said Wednesday that it would hike prices on staples like Scott toilet paper and Huggies diapers, joining the growing list of consumer products companies that are raising prices.

articles.title: Honda recalls over 628,000 vehicles to replace fuel pumps
articles.description: Honda is recalling more than 628,000 vehicles in the U.S. to replace fuel pumps that can fail, causing the engines to stall.
articles.content:
Honda is recalling more than 628,000 vehicles in the U.S. to replace fuel pumps that can fail, causing the engines to stall.
The recall covers much of the Honda and Acura model lineup from the 2018 to 2020 model years including the CR-V small SUV, th... [776 chars]

articles.title: I Had a Latte Loaded With Delta-8 THC, a Legal Weed That Gets You High
articles.description: Like CBD, delta-8 THC can be derived from hemp and exists in a legal loophole. But this cannabinoid will actually leave you feeling buzzed.
articles.content:
Delta-8 THC is gaining popularity as a new weed compound that's basically legal.
This cannabinoid gets you high but is less potent than other kinds of THC, and possibly less anxiety-inducing.

articles.title: End of a Covid era: Delta to stop blocking middle seats on May 1
articles.description: Delta says it will start selling all seats on board starting May 1, ending more than a year of Covid-era capacity caps.
articles.content:
Delta Air Lines said Wednesday it will stop blocking seats on its planes starting May 1, the last U.S. airline to end the Covid-19-era policy as more travelers return to the skies.

articles.description: Critics of Robinhood have claimed the company has made light of decisions that involve real money.
articles.content:
Robinhood is redesigning some of its app features — most notably ditching its confetti animation —amid scrutiny over the popular stock trading company's so-called gamification of investing.

articles.title: Strength-training startup Tonal crosses unicorn status after raising $250M
articles.description: When the pandemic unfolded last year, demand for at-home fitness equipment skyrocketed, and Tonal was no exception. The maker of a smart home fitness trainer experienced an explosive increase in sales, and now the six-year-old San Francisco-based startup is gearing up for its next stage of growth.
